content.description: Start on an overhanging pinch, and climb through the overhang on the left side of the cave.  Top out on the platform above ?Chick Problem? area.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Pete-15

on the left hand side of a cave.

content.description:
Shake Yer Money Maker is one of the best short routes on The Pass!

A tricky move off the ground leads to a shake at half height. Then intricate climbing with fantastic arete movement gains the chains. It is probably akin to a long V5/6 boulder problem.
content.location: This is located on the southeast arete of the Big Wild Boulder.

climbs.name: Pete-15
climbs.fa: Equipped by Chris Goplerud, FirstTR: Tommy Caldwell, FirstRP: Josh Wharton Fall '05

content.description:
This is another excellent mini-route on the Big Wild Boulder's east face.

Underclings out an arch lead to a definite crux, and then thin face climbing to a two bolt anchor. Folks under 5' 8" (or those that are very flexible) may find this route much easier if they discover the "short guy" beta. It was named in honor of an Aspen area climber who recently passed away.
content.location:
This is between

Shake Yer Money Maker

and

V1

.

content.description: Sit start matching on an edge. Climb up and right on the overhanging face on juggy holds to a heel hook mantle.
content.location:
On the left side of the south face of the Big Wild Boulder, this is just left of

Funky Chicken

.

content.description: Sit start at the holds of ?Chick Problem?, but climb straight up using a small, right-facing arete/corner.
content.location: On the South side of Wild Rock Boulder, use the same start as ?Chick Problem?.

content.description: Start on a triangle-shaped hold around 5' up, climb straight up, and mantle.
content.location:
This is left of

Moon Tide

on the south side of the Big Wild Boulder.

content.description: Sit start on a sloping rail right of the ?Chick Problem? start above a flat rock in the ground. Climb up and left.

Several easier problems are on the backside of the James Brown Boulder. I believe it is technically called the Big Wild Boulder, and it has a huge overhanging face that is about 8-10 feet tall. It has grassy top-outs!

The Chick Problem starts on a low blocky hold and moves along a seam to the top-out.

A better topo can be found here:

independencebouldering.com/â€¦

.

Per

Pete F

: sit down, and start on a low, juggy rail. Climb up and right along a seam to a crux before the lip involving a couple of odd, sloping pinches.

Eds. this is a combination of two submissions made into one to avoid duplication.
content.protection: Pad. The landing is really good.
content.location:
Approaching the James Brown Boulder from the main trail head to the leftside of the first massive boulder you run into. It is hidden back in there.

Per

Pete F

: this is on the South side of Big Wild Boulder, toward the right side of the south face.
